column4: hi im getting this error when trying to open 'System-->Add application'
Unable to copy the user's Xauthorization file.
does anyone knows how to fix this?
thanks in advance.
do any of the admin tools work for you?
no, all gives me the same error.
when googled i read that i need to change ownership of .Xauthority file, but there is one file per user. so where should i change? the file for root, or file for the current user?
file for current user, I think
ok. then there is another problem, how to specify the owner of file as 'Anybody'. This is what a solution page told me to do. But chown says 'Anybody' is invalid user.
what page are you reading?
this is the page  http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=781066&postcount=13
sorry this is the correct page : https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-users/2005-June/039871.html
sudo rm ~/.Xauthority - and read the next two or three lines below that phrase in the URL you just gave
ok thank you. i will try that then.
it's OK to remove (rm) .Xauthority because it gets re-created on every new login
ok. thanks for that information. i was afraid to do so :-)
one more doubt, do i need to restart X to see effect of changing ownership of the .Xauthority?
yes - do the rm command in terminal, then hit Ctrl+Alt+Backspace to kill & restart X
ok thank you.
